title: Spicy Honey Balsamic Chicken Strip Bowl

ingredients.name: boneless chicken breast, sliced into 1/2-inch strips
Brussels sprouts (seasoned with garlic powder, onion powder, paprika)

directions: Slice chicken breast into 1/2-inch strips against the grain.
Season strips lightly with salt and pepper.
Mix the sauce: combine spicy honey sauce, fig balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken strips until browned and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes total.
Lower heat and pour in the sauce mix. Toss for 30-60 seconds until it thickens and coats the chicken.
Reserve a few spoonfuls of sauce in the pan to drizzle over the rice and Brussels sprouts.
Assemble bowls with rice, roasted Brussels sprouts, and glazed chicken strips. Drizzle with extra sauce.
notes: One of three sauce options for chicken strip bowls. The spicy honey + fig balsamic creates sweet heat with a tangy finish that pairs beautifully with paprika-garlic Brussels sprouts. Alternative sauce options: (1) Peri-Peri Glaze -- 3 tbsp peri-peri sauce, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tbsp honey; (2) Roasted Red Pepper Almond Pesto -- 3 tbsp pesto, 1.5 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp water. Season Brussels with garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika.
